intro: Rhynchosinapis hispida, commonly known as the hairy rhynchosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive tactile texture. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to green in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Rhynchosinapis hispida is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
